unique_internal_blocks.text: Today in a CNBC interview, I called for a review of the Federal Reserve. unique_internal_blocks.title: PeterSchiff
unique_internal_blocks.text: Powell blames all of the near-term inflation risk on tariffs. In truth, the overall risk results from past and present Fed monetary policy of repeated QE and keeping interest rates too low for too long, which fueled excess consumption and enabled continued government profligacy.

unique_internal_blocks.title: This time, Trump's the inflation villain - not Powell!
unique_internal_blocks.text: It’s happening. Was in Home Depot yesterday to return a wrench set I had purchased and get a different set. The price of the same set just metric went up $15. One of the Rigid sales reps was right next to me, I wasn’t happy and he explained they just went through the store and adjusted prices on just about everything because of tariffs. Some BS!
